column1: depending on whether I go to the monthly EA community event in which we discuss and help people with EA ideas to specify them and execute them. When I go there it would be 4 hours a month.
Varies, a couple of hours volunteering per month.
does involvement with my local church count?
Depends on whether I'm working on a project, so 0-30 hours
Currently taking care of my 92 yr old mother so I am limited
?? I work full-time on AI strategy for EA reasons.
I'm involved in Smart Recovery Friends and Family - I don't know if that qualifies. Scientific research is part of their reason for being.
I am on a break at the moment, but under normal circumstances I would do 2-5 hours a month
I don<89>۪t specifically <89><db><cf>volunteer<89>۝ I do try to help people any time the opportunity arises. I work in the STEM/trade field so I<89>۪m able to do that often.
I do what I can for gun control
~40 if working on a startup counts
80-100, though I<e5><ab>m paid for it now
Either between 90-120, or 0, depending on whether grantmaking counts.
I volunteer around 32 hours a month, for causes I consider altruistic and effective, but would not fit the narrower profile of your organisation
4 but not necessarily for EA causes
I purchase 4 weeks leave per year from my employer to work on self-funded arts project with traditional owners
I'm working full time for a charity
variable at present as I am just a few weeks where I live
It depends. I spend all my time studying AI/comp-neuro, without exception. I am not sure how 'volunteering' is intended.
Running effective altruism society: 10 hours per week
1 hour per week roughly, less than that most of the time
I do lots of volunteering but would not call it EA
40 hours per month learning about manufacture engineering because I want to be useful for projects at scale
They depend on how much free time I have as I am still a student, but my work in the student council I hope can be taken in to an account.

I consider that my field of work supports my engagement as an Effective Altruits: I am working in chemicals and waste management at the UN Environment, and I work for a circular economy, and pollution-free world as pollution is the highest cause of deaths and sickness in the world

I volunteer for a sustainability organisation, I'm not sure it's really an EA cause specifically, but it's the best organisation I've found to volunteer with in my area. I'd certainly be interested in working with 'EA approved' causes though.
6 hours but not for causes championed by effective altruism
Can't calculate the # of hours, but give about 10% of net income
Try to get my workplace involved once a year (ie i shave my head or do a run and ask them to donate to a EA charity).  Unable to say how many hours
I just went to my first Humane League work party and hoping to come back for more.
varies, I sometimes volunteer for The Humane League
6 (running a university group--doesn't seem so effective so far...)
I'm employed for an EA org, so the answer to this question is indeterminate
10-20ish? (I do stuff that I don't get paid for, but I do get paid for most of my work.)
varies, but I would say about two hours the last six months
I work full time for an EA cause
6 (spending time in the local EA group, although a bit unregularly)
Seasonally! Maybe 18 hours/month during the volunteer "season"
I work with an EA Org so overtime? ;)
60 (or 0, I work for an EA org)
I work at an EA org
As large a portion of my life as possible
I work full-time on existential risk reduction.
right now I am running an EA project full time, but there is some money involved, so ???
10-20, but they are paid freelance work, so not sure if it counts
I work fulltime for an EA org, which is ~40hr/week. In addition, I do ~1 more hours worth of stuff.
10 (this is a wild guess, and counts hours I spend on stuff I consider EA stuff, but not time that I spend earning money)

40 (80% community building, 15% SHIC, 5% Charity Science) (though this will soon be changing, as I am now funded to put more hours into community building, and I will still put many into SHIC and Charity Science)
